description: Unique identifier for this schedule‑meter record; serves as the primary key.
Identifier of the asset maintenance schedule/procedure this meter drives; likely a foreign key to the schedule–asset–procedure entity; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether this is the primary meter driving the maintenance schedule for the asset/procedure.
Reference to the type of meter (e.g., odometer, engine hours, cycles) that defines the unit of measure.
Interval, in meter units, between scheduled services for this procedure (e.g., every 6,000 miles or hours).
Percent of the interval used for early warning or advance scheduling (due‑soon threshold); likely defines how far before target the job can be planned; confirm with SME.
Meter reading recorded when the maintenance was last completed for this schedule.
Meter reading at which the maintenance was last planned or scheduled (may differ from completion reading).
Initial meter reading at which this schedule becomes active; likely the baseline for the first interval; confirm with SME.
Meter reading at which this schedule stops applying or is capped; used to end scheduling; confirm with SME.
Option code or bitmask controlling scheduling behavior for this meter (e.g., reset or forecast rules); definitions maintained in configuration; confirm with SME.
System timestamp when the record was last modified.
Timestamp when a user last modified the record as captured by the application; likely aligns with system modification time; confirm with SME.
Meter rollover setting or value (maximum count before reset) used when computing next due; confirm with SME.
Code indicating the scheduling method used (e.g., meter‑based, forecasted, or mixed); confirm with SME.
Indicator that the record originated from a data import rather than manual entry.
Identifier of the user who created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
Identifier of the user who last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified by a user.
